job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
Local Seattle Area Candidates Only Please!   The digital nexus where ESG and price signals merge.Xpansiv is the global market for ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance)-inclusive commodities. These Intelligent Commodities™ bring transparency to markets, empowering participants to value energy, carbon, and water to meet the challenges of an information-rich, resource-constrained world.   We’re the marketplace for an ever-expanding ecosystem of proven environmental commodities, like RECs (Renewable Energy Certificates), offsets, and differentiated fuels. We connect buyers and sellers of Intelligent Commodities in a global liquidity hub that accelerates the transition to a net-zero future.   Job DescriptionAs a Site Reliability Engineer, you will design, implement, and support our core infrastructure. The SRE team is responsible for reliability, scalability, and automation while keeping an eye on latency,&nbsp;security, performance, and capacity. You will also mentor, share knowledge, and guide technical decisions toward long-term success. As a key hire on a growing engineering team, you’ll have a deep impact on engineering practices and culture. As an SRE you will:     - Deploy and maintain our infrastructure, and improve the process to make it as boring as possible.   
  - Document every action into repeatable actions&nbsp;–&nbsp;and then automation.   
  - Debug production issues across all services and levels of the stack.   
  - Own, maintain, and continuously improve all systems provided as a service, such as monitoring and datastores.   
  - Research and implement changes to increase reliability and operate more efficiently.   
   Who We're Looking For  - Someone with intense curiosity and humility.   
  - Someone who can get challenging projects across the finish line.   
  - Someone who is empathetic, patient, and passionate about helping teammates grow.   
  - Someone who is collaborative, and who can influence diverse engineering teams.   
  - Someone with experience running applications in production.   
  - Someone who takes engineering best practices seriously, who cares about reliability and end-user trust, and who will advocate for all of these things.   
   Technical Requirements  - Fluency in a programming language. (We use Python and Bash where possible.)   
  - Familiarity with command-line Linux.   
  - Familiarity with version control. (We use git.)   
  - Familiarity with some form of infrastructure as code. (We use Terraform where possible.)   
  - Familiarity and comfort with at least one cloud provider. (We use AWS where possible.)   
  - Three years of experience in some combination of software engineering, systems administration, backend automation, testing automation, data engineering, or similar work. This should include operational responsibility for business-critical systems in a collaborative environment.   
   Bonus Points  - Six, ten, or more years of experience, in a diverse range of environments and architectures.   
  - Strong fluency in Python, and experience writing software.   
  - Strong fluency in Linux, and experience with medium-to-large scale environments.   
  - Familiarity with running systems with a microservice architecture.   
  - Familiarity with data persistence technologies (for example, Elastisearch, Kafka, or Redis).   
   We encourage you to apply if this role excites you&nbsp;—&nbsp;We are always looking for outstanding individuals with diverse backgrounds and perspectives who embody trust, transparency, collaboration, and a can-do attitude. We’re excited to meet you!
